definition: to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: She awoke early after a disturbed night.
sentences.chinese: 她一夜心神煩亂，很早就醒了。

sentences.english: That period of time, the mood in the days maple Fanluan, trance.
sentences.chinese: 那一段日子，於天楓心情煩亂，精神恍惚。

sentences.english: A myriad of thoughts crowded into our minds when we revisited the old haunt.
sentences.chinese: 瑪吉把身子轉了過去，思緒萬千，心境煩亂。

sentences.english: Things happened so fast that Mary was at sixes and sevens.
sentences.chinese: 事情發生得如此快，以致瑪麗心緒煩亂。

sentences.english: It is futile to practice meditation if your mind is always involved in either dullness or agitation.
sentences.chinese: 若修禪定，心卻忙於煩亂或昏沉，也是徒勞。

sentences.english: Faced with these things in the past, I became annoyed and exasperated.
sentences.chinese: 過去，當我面對這些情形時，我會變得很煩亂和惱怒。

sentences.english: He was too upset to distinguish vice from virtue.
sentences.chinese: 他心情太煩亂了，無法分辨善惡。

definition: lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
